thread.title_full: Ratings and Sentiment Update on S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA)

title: Ratings and Sentiment Update on S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA)
text:
Home » Analyst Views » Ratings and Sentiment Update on S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) Ratings and Sentiment Update on S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) on October 15, 2015 
Shares of S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) have been given a Buy-Sell rating of 2.8 by Zacks Research. This is based on 3 analyst reports taken into consideration. Brokerage research firms often use different terminology for their stock recommendations. In order to get a simplified consensus recommendation, Zacks uses a simplified 1 to 5 scale in order to obtain an Average Broker Rating. 1 represents a Strong Buy recommendation where 5 a Strong Sell. Stocks with a low rating means they are a Buy or Strong Buy based on analyst consensus opinion. A stock with a higher rating (3-5) yields an average recommendation of Hold, Sell or Strong Sell. Three months ago the stock had a 2.8 rating, which gives an idea of which direction sentiment is headed. 
Taking a look at price target projections, covering sell-side analysts have placed a one year objective of $31.666 on a consensus basis. The projections range from the most bullish number of $32 to the most conservative of $31. 
Earnings Look 
Brokerage firms and investors will be watching when S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) reports their next earnings announcement on or around 2015-10-20. Analysts are anticipating earnings of $0.58 for the current fiscal quarter which closes on 2015-09-30 for the firm. This is the consensus or average EPS number based on the analysts polled by Zacks. This number can often slightly differ from the Thomson Reuters First Call estimate. 
Earnings per share is often the most important number of the earnings release as an earnings surprise can lead to swings in the share price immediately following the release. Most recently the firm posted an earnings surprise of 6.12%. The reported EPS number was $0.03 away from what analysts had expected. 
In looking at more immediate sentiment, we can take a look at Alpha One sentiment analysis on the stock. This helps identify the daily attitude of an equity based on news reports and articles and whether or not the news might positively or negatively impact the stock, based on a -1 to 1 scale. The sentiment score for S&T Bancorp, Inc. based on news from 2015-10-04 yields a score of 0. Alpha One also offers daily impact scores which indicate how likely company news on a given day will impact the company’s stock by more than 1%. This is based on a 1-100 scale with 100 being very likely that the stock will move on the news. For 2015-10-04 shares of S&T Bancorp, Inc. were given an impact score of 86. 
Shares of the stock traded in the range of $31.59 to 32.41 and closed the most recent session at 31.76. 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. (S&T) is a bank holding company and has three wholly owned subsidiaries, S&T Bank, 9th Street Holdings, Inc. and STBA Capital Trust I. The Company also owns certain interest in Commonwealth Trust Credit Life Insurance Company. As of December 31, 2012, the Company had approximately .4 billion in loans and .6 billion in deposits. S&T Bank is a full service bank. It provides its services to its customers through offices located in Allegheny, Armstrong, Blair, Butler, Cambria, Clarion, Clearfield, Indiana, Jefferson and Westmoreland counties of Pennsylvania. It operates in three segments: Community Banking, Wealth Management and Insurance. Its Community Banking segment offers services, which include accepting time and demand deposit accounts, originating commercial and consumer loans, and providing letters of credit and credit card services. The Wealth Management segment offers discount brokerage services, services as executor and trustee under wills and deeds.
